Reviews.Author: NYDAz

Reviews.Content: Ironic location of such budget hotel on such designer street! As per title! - received surprise when we went to check in..! - in the one building and next door was where we stayed! VERY Basic Hotel - not good value for money. One good point is that is is very close to the Van Gough Museum which is definitely worth a visit as is the Anne Frank Museum (not near hotel - but that is ok!) Even though it is very near the Van Gough Museum so are many other Hotels so you do not need to choose it for this reason. They have marketed this hotel (pictures on Internet) extremely well - its looks fine from the pictures but there is definitely a very different and far more budget feel when you get into the place! We only booked a week before we went so our choice of accomodation was limited but I still did not think from the Internet that this looked as budget as it was and it was not a budget price that we paid. It was not the worse place in the world but certainly Extremely Basic and if you enjoy or like to mooch around a 'Hotel' space - then this is Definitely not the place for you and if you do not like climing tenament stairs either consider this! We had toured around Belgium before getting here and there was not a croissant in site for Breakfast not even a roll for that matter - plain bread and a toaster was where it was at - some cheese, ham, basic cereals and concentrated juice - so just bare in mind! Still enjoyed our stay in Amsterdam :) - after all the accomodation should not make the holiday but a nice base is always an added bonus!
Reviews.Author: SusannePegg

Reviews.Content: absolute disaster booked this hotel over internet read several reviews and decided that overall it was not to bad. that was a laugh,we booked a standard double cost 448 euros for four nights.got there at 1800 hrs and rang reception door.the hotel is situated on the most expensive street in amsterdam with many designer shops on it, thought it was going to be ok. wrong, wrong, wrong.the reception staff were nice enough gave us the key and showed us the rooom in the next building, the rooms were in one building the reception and breakfast room another. we walked into the room and looked around. we were to stunned to speak to each other, the bathroom, rather shower room was filthy with mould all over the walls shower curtain and door frames. the carpet in the room looked as if it had not been cleaned in serveral decades and the furniture was from the 1960's. there was a mini bar fridge with nothing in it execpt mould.my partner was furious and we were hardly speaking to each other. i went to reception and stated it was not possible for us to stay in such a filthy place and asked for another room stating this was not the one seen on the photos. they said that they had a double delux room which they used for the photos would we like that our reply was yes until we were informed that it would be an extra 60 euros per night, after some negotiation we got it for an extra 7.50 euro a night. the delux double was slightly better, the shower room slightly cleaner, but on closer inspection you could still see traces of mould again the mini fridge had mould inside and when we lifted the sheet to look at the mattress we were almost sick, it was full of stains and looked like it had come from a skip. also we noted there to be blood stains down the bed side cabinet and wall. we simply could not stay there we left the room and walked and could not look at each other or we would both have cryed. my partner decided that we would go back and get the next flight home.on our way back we spotted another hoel over the road a delux boutique hotel and were fourtunate enough that they had a room for three nights. we immediatley went bacvk to the bellington demanded our money back, which they gave without any problems minus the cost of one night,they were obviously used to giving poeple there money back, and promtly departed.all we can say is nerver never stay in the bellington it was not fit to put animals in let alone humans. we complained to the dutch tourist board and said they really needed to review how the star rating is given, to give the bellington a 2 star rating you would need to be high on something or given a very big bribe. please do not stay here, if you do on your own head be it.
Reviews.Author: simo171960

Reviews.Content: NIce hotel with friendly staff The rooms are basic but this hotel has a very friendly staff(!) The location is great it was near the tijksmuseum and the van gogh museum. In the night it is very silent so we had a very good sleep. We had a nice and clean room wich was cleaned daily. The breakfast was a bit early for us but for the last day we manage to get a breakfast and it is was a good starter for the day.
Reviews.Author: woodson

Reviews.Content: Nice location, basic rooms hotel is situated in a very quiet neighbourghood, on the street of most luxurious shops in the city, close to the beautiful park and very close to the museums' district. The location is a great advantage. But the rooms need to be renovated and are very basic, low water pressure, really budget standard. If you have an opportunity, choose a double room on the last floor - it has really nice view! Quite good breakfast (ham, cheese, marmolade, cornflakes, juice, toats, coffeetea)
Reviews.Author: AnnaWarsaw

Reviews.Content: Absolute Disaster! I stayed at this hotel due to the good reviews that were deposited on this website but when we arrived our worst nightmares struck!The shower absolutely stunk of urine! there was mold in the shower! mold on the shower curtain! the toilet was old and unclean, the shower area needed ripping out and a new one installing.The bedroom was awful, tv was just about working, curtains were over 100years old, carpet was really old and dirty, I was bitten in teh night several times. The en-suite washbasin which is bascially in room is really old and looks bad.The whole room is basically the worst thing I have ever seen! I can live with budget rooms! but this was not budget! I wouldnt let an animal live in these conditions!We did complain to recpetion but we got the usual recpetion of 'sorry all rooms are full but you can have a standard single room' No thanks! if this is bad imagine what the budget room is like!We did try to get an other room in town but because it was good friday weekend everywhere was full!I would also like to say if you are english and you like you fry-ups! dont there breakfast is crap! just ham and eggs!I would think twice mayble 10 times before going here! I am really dissapointed and would advise all people to check other accomodation elswhere!tip:The park hotel looks like a good hotel just by Vondel ParkThanks for reading my review on the worst hotel I have ever stayed in in my life!Michael McHugh

Reviews.Author: jessnatl

Reviews.Content: Cheap and Cheerful We stayed in the double deluxe room for 3 nights. Good value for money. Excellent tram service for getting to the centre. Good quiet location. We didn't have breakfast as are not early morning people, instead we ate at the Van Gough cafe at the end of the road which was very pleasant.The room was a good size and if you wanted to watch TV there were a good few English channels to choose from. A couple of previous reviews mention mold. There was a some mildew in the shower but not enough to smell at all. You get what you pay for at the end of the day. The room was old fashioned but clean and there were clean towels and bedsheets.The only problem we had was that the heating didn't work which we complained about. This wasn't fixed but as the weather was quite warm this didn't bother us. Overall I would say that this hotel is very good value for money and I would stay here again, but I am not sure if I would risk going in the winter as it may be a bit cold!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: good stay Well these points are nice about my stay at hotel Bellington- this is a good place for budget travellers to book in to a nice hotel for low rate- friendly- very helpful staff- nice room - hotel location is quiet and near the center- good breakfast (including in the roomrate)- we enjoyed our stay very much and looking forward to come back to hotel bellington.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: nice and pleasent stay with my friends After checking some hotels in Amsterdam me and my friends decided to stay at hotel bellington. We were given a room on the front of the hotel with a view to the street and a room on the back of the hotel with a nice view over the gardens. The rooms that we had were equiped with a television and other needs that we didn't need, we were on vacation afterall(!) The location of the hotel is excellent the sightseeings are al nearby we didn't have to take a taxi or public transport to go to there. Even the leidseplein was 5 minutes walking distance from the hotel with the nightlife and restaurants so we didn't had to worry if we got hungry. The breakfast was just fine it was selfservice and we could fill our tummy. I don't know what the previeus reviewer had but we had hot water and also heating in our room. The staff was also very kind and helpfull. Thank you all for the pleasent stay and the information we received. Well if we visit amsterdam again we wil you again.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Pig Sty!!! My dog Benji resides at better kennels! I had never had the misfortune to stay in such a filthy, smelly, dingy so called hotel!How they have audacity to charge around 拢30 per night i will never know and in fairness they should have paid me to stay there.The room resembled a prison cell, with no hot water, mouldy shower, fold up beds, no blankets or clean linen, no heating (November) no toiletires, and no mirror. I decided to look for different accomodation after spending one night there and feel it is only fair to warn other travellers.

Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Quiet, pleasant and friendly; weary furniture I stayed in Hotel Bellington's double deluxe room with my boyfriend in August 2005. The location of the hotel is luxurious as it is surrounded by such stores as Cartier, Gucci and Louis Vuitton. The hotel itself is a bit weary and the bed squeaks, but the room was very clean. Don't expect the room to be be too well equipped - but the small TV is there! The staff is very friendly, although their English skills could be improved a bit... We used tram to get to the hotel from the central station, but otherwise you can walk to the centre and to the museums. The stay in Bellington is pleasant if you don't expect any lux INSIDE the hotel!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Very good location and friendly host!       Bellington Outside
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: exellent experience and good pricing What a friendly place! I have stayed at this hotel three times on my numeorus visits to Amsterdam and have always left wanting to come back. In a superb location just outside the city by the Vondelpark and Rijksmuseum but with excellent walking access to all of the city centre attractions this is far and away one of the better budget options. Ok, the rooms are not luxury and sharing a shower and toilet is a drag but here it is a lot better than many other options. It is also a lovely traditional Dutch building on the most swanky street in Holland! And if your going to complain about climbing stairs while in Amsterdam your obviously a really fun person who knows how to have a good time! Its all part of the experience and if you do get a room on the top floor you should consider yourselves lucky for the free yet breathtaking views of the city. And I have always found the breakfast to be just fine.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Inexpensive family run hotel in a good QUIET location We selected the hotel because of its value. Considering its urban location, the rate for a double was excellent!It is located on the toniest shopping street in all of the Netherlands and is very close to the Museumplein and the Lidesplein. We also enjoyed having access to the Vondelpark at the end ofthe street. The tram to Centraal Station got us there in about 15 minutes. Because the street is all retail, it was very quiet for being in central Amsterdam...a definite plus in my book. Breakfast was fine, very typical of Eurpoean B and Bs.If anyone has issues with stairs, be warned that there is no lift and the stairs are steep and narrow. Neverthless, we enjoyed the Bellington for its location and value.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Small, Cheap, Good Location We've stayed in Bellington Hotel in July 2004. Its a tiny hotel right in the midst of the Amsterdam's high street PC Hoofstraat. Quite location. Walking distance from Museum Plein and Vondelpark and Leidenstraat (probably I misspell this name)The rate was good, sth around 60 euros per a double-room. Breakfast was too early and too small. Though we were leaving earlier than initially decided to stay they have charged us full amount for all the nights we had reserved.As the building where the hotel is situated is really tiny as the most of Amsterdam's old buildings are the stairs had an angle of sth like 90 degrees so for us living in the second floor it was quite a problem to climb so high as we were already quite high...:) So, the greatest thing about this hotel is the price in conjunction with the location.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
